question:
Select the set in which the numbers are related in the same way as are the numbers of the following set.

(NOTE: Operations should be performed on the whole numbers, without breaking down the numbers into its constituent digits. E.g. 13-Operations on 13 such as adding/subtracting /multiplying etc. to 13 can be performed. Breaking down 13 into 1 and 3 and then performing mathematical operations on 1 and 3 is NOT allowed)

(240, 55, 65)

(320, 85, 75)
solution:
(c)

Logic: (Second number + Third number) x 2 = First number i.e.

(240, 55, 65) ⇒(55 + 65) x 2 = 240

(320, 85, 75) ⇒ (85 + 75) x 2 = 320

Similarly,

(160, 35, 45)⇒ (35 + 45) x 2 = 160

question:

Some doctors are painters.

Some doctors are labours.

All the labours are athletes.

Conclusions:

I. Some labours are painters.

II. Some athletes are doctors.

III. All the doctors are athletes.

IV. Some athletes are painters.
option_1: Only conclusions II and III follow
option_4: Only conclusions I and II follow
solution:
(b)

Only conclusion II follows.

question: Which of the given sectors is largely driven by considerations of social welfare?
solution: (c) Public sector (completely owned and operated by the government of the country) promotes social welfare by providing basic amenities to citizens of the country. Main purpose of the private sector (owned, controlled and managed either by individuals or business entities) is to make profits. Purpose of the Cooperative sector (owned and operated by a collective of individuals) is to provide and distribute benefits to members based on their use. Purpose of foreign sector is to undertake external activity that is outside the control of the domestic economy.

question: The Hindu college was established in 1791 at _________.
solution:
(d)

Hindu College (Banaras, 1791). In 1791, Jonathan Duncan started the Sanskrit College at Benares to promote the study of Hindu laws and philosophy in Banaras. In 1958, the Sanskrit College became a university and in 1974 the name was changed to Sampurnanand Sanskrit University. Some other famous universities: Calcutta University (Lord Canning, 1857), Aligarh Muslim University (Sir Syed Ahmad Khan, 1875), Banaras Hindu University (1916- Madan Mohan Malviye).

question: In which of the following languages did Jyotiba Phule write 'Gulamgiri' in 1873 ?
solution:
(b)

Marathi. Jyotiba Phule was born on 11 April 1827 in Pune, Maharashtra. In 1873, he formed the Satyashodhak Samaj, Maharashtra. Some of his famous books; Gulamgiri (Slavery) and Shetkaryacha Asud (Cultivator's Whipcord) , 'Tritiya Ratna', 'Sarvajanik Satyadharma', etc.

question: Which of the following are Rabi crops only?
solution:
(b)

Rabi crops (October-November); Wheat, Barley, Gram, Masoor, Linseed, Peas and Mustard. Kharif crops (June- July); Paddy (Rice), Maize, Jowar, Bajra, Moong, Groundnut, Sugarcane, Soybean, Urad, Tur, Kulthi, Jute, Flax, Cotton etc. Zaid crops (March-April); Watermelon, Cucumber, Muskmelon, Moong, Urad, Sunflower etc.

question: Identify an example of organisms that are free-swimming and bottom-dwelling forms.
solution:
(b)

Zooplankton are free-swimming and bottom- dwelling forms. Zooplankton are a type of heterotrophic plankton that range from microscopic organisms to large species, such as jellyfish, larval crustaceans, krill, copepods, protozoans, etc. Phytoplankton are mostly microscopic, single-celled photosynthetic organisms that live suspended in water, such as algae and diatoms. Fungi (eukaryotic organisms), jelly fishes (Phylum Cnidaria Cnidarians).

question: Which of the following cities hosted the 2019 Military World Games organised by the International Military Sports Council?
solution:
(c)

Wuhan, China hosted the 2019 military world games organized by the international military sports council. Flag bearer (Yuan Jinyu), Champion (China). International Military Games 2021 (Host - Russia; Champion- Russia); 2022 (Host - Russia).

question: 32. Abdul Karim Khan was the exponent of which school of Hindustani Music?
solution:
(d)

Abdul Karim Khan was the founder and exponent of the Kirana Gharana school of Hindustani music. He introduced Hindustani Khayal singing and Indian classical music. Gwalior Gharana (oldest gharana; founder: Haddu Khan, Hassu Khan and Nathu Khan). Jaipur gharana (founder: Alladiya Khan). Delhi gharana (founder: Hazrat Ameer Khusro).

question: Who has taken oath as Bihar Chief Minister for 8th time?
solution:
(d)

Nitish Kumar has taken oath as the Chief Minister of Bihar for the 8th time. Bihar : Governor: Phagu chauhan (As of Dec 2022) ; Establishment; 22 march 1912 ; National animal; gaur ; Bird; Indian Roller. Pramod Sawant (Chief Minister of Goa); Tejashwi Yadav (Deputy CM of Bihar); Anugrah Narayan Sinha (First deputy CM and Finance minister of Bihar).

question: Which of the following statements about cell cycle is FALSE?
option_1: Preparation of mitosis takes place in G2 phase.
option_2: In M phase, the cell grows physically larger and copies organelles.
option_3: In S phase, replication of DNA takes place.
option_4: In G1 phase, the cell grows physically larger and copies organelles.
solution:
(b)

Statement (b) is incorrect. The different phases of a cell cycle include: Interphase (This phase includes the G1 phase, S phase and the G2 phase), M phase (This is the mitotic phase and is divided into prophase, metaphase, anaphase and telophase) and Cytokinesis (In this phase the cytoplasm of the cell divides).

question: Shyamji Krishna Varma established India House at ________ in 1905.
solution:
(d)

Shyamji Krishna Varma established the India House in London in 1905. Their aim was to promote the cause of self-rule in British India. He also founded "The Indian Sociologist" and the Indian Home Rule Society in 1905.

question: 'Indira Gandhi Shehri Rozgar Guarantee Yojana 2022' has been implemented by which state government?
solution:
(a)

‘Indira Gandhi Shehri Rozgar guarantee Yojana 2022’ has been implemented by the Government of Rajasthan. Through this scheme 100 days of employment will be provided on the work demanded on the lines of (The Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act- 2006) in urban areas.

question: Choose the correct pair from the following options.
option_1: Third Five-year Plan - Rapid industrialisation and basic industries
option_2: Fourth Five-year Plan - Family planning programme
option_4: Second Five-year Plan - Focus on agriculture
solution:
(b)

Fourth five-year -plan (1974-1979) - Main focus: family planning programme.

First five-year plan (1951 - 1956): Harrod Domar Model: Main focus: agricultural development. Second five-year plan (1956 - 1961): Mahalanobis model: Main focus: Industry. Third five-year plan (1961 - 1966): John Sandy and Sukhamoy Chakravarty Model; Main focus; agriculture and wheat production.

question: Fundamental Duties were added in the Constitution of India under the leadership of which Prime Minister of India?
solution:
(c)

The Fundamental Duties were added to the Constitution of India under the leadership of Indira Gandhi. It was included in Part IV-A of the Constitution by the 42nd Constitutional Amendment Act, 1976 on the recommendations of the Swaran Singh Committee.

question: Which of the following festivals is celebrated in the month of August-September?
solution:
(d)

Onam (Kerala) festival is celebrated in the month of August - September. Makar Sankranti (Punjab), Bikaner festival (Rajasthan) and kite Festival (Gujarat) are celebrated in the month of January. Other Festivals of Kerala:- Thrissur Pooram festival, Boat festival, Attukal Pongala Festival, Vishu, Makaravilakku at Sabarimala Festival, Theyyam Festival.

question: 'Mission Kushal Karmi' was launched to upgrade the skills of construction workers. This programme was launched by the government of _________.
solution:
(d)

The Delhi government launched the 'Mission Kushal Karmi' program on 6 July 2022 to upgrade the skills of construction workers. The Delhi government aims to train 2 lakh workers in a year under this programme. Delhi: Lieutenant Governor (Vinay Kumar Saxena); Chief Minister (Arvind Kejriwal).

question: First edition of the Youth Olympic Games was held at __________.
solution:
(b)

First edition (2010) of the Youth Olympic Games was held in Singapore.Tag line; blazing the trail. 2018 youth olympic games : Host city (Buenos Aires, Argentina), Winner (China). 2014- Nanjing (China), 2026- Dakar (Senegal).

question: Thorny bushes are found in __________ region.
solution:
(c)

Thorny bushes are found in dry desert areas. In areas where there is less than 70 cm of rainfall, thorn forests and shrubs are found in the natural vegetation. This type of vegetation is found in the north-western parts of the country, which include the semi-arid regions of Gujarat, Rajasthan, Chhattisgarh, Madhya Pradesh, Uttar Pradesh and Haryana.

question: Which of the following folk dance forms does NOT belong to the state of Gujarat?
solution:
(c)

Bidesiya is a folk dance form of Bihar. Other dance forms of Bihar include jat-jatin, Jumri, Jhijhiya, Kajri, Paika, Sama Chakewa, etc. Gujarat: Garba, Dandiya, Bhavai, Dandiya Raas, Tippani, Padhar, Hoodo, etc.

question: Who among the following classical dancers was rewarded with the Padma Vibhushan Award in 2003?
solution:
(a)

Sonal Mansingh (Bharatanatyam and Odissi) was awarded the Padma Vibhushan Award in 2003. Awards and honors : Padma Bhushan (1992), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1987), Rajiv Gandhi Excellence Award (1991), Indira Priyadarshini Award (1994), Madhya Pradesh Government's Kalidas Samman (2006). (Shovana Narayan, Kumudini Lakhia and Sunayana Hazar - Kathak).

question: The SI unit of acceleration is ________.
solution:
(d)

The SI unit of acceleration is m/s2. Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity with respect to time. m/s (Speed). Some other important SI units: Luminous Intensity – Candela, Electric current; Ampere,Temperature; Kelvin, wavelength; Angstrom, force; Newton, etc.

question: The Tamil word 'muvendar' mentioned in the Sangam poems means
solution:
(d)

The Tamil word 'muvendar' mentioned in the sangam poems means three chiefs, used for the heads of the three ruling families, the Cholas, Cheras and Pandyas.

question: The Vice President of India is elected for a period of _______years.
solution:
(b)

The Vice President of India is elected for a term of 5 years. He should be of minimum 35 years of age and not holding any office of profit. Articles 63-71, (Part-5, the union) deal with the qualification, election and removal of the Vice President of India.

question: Which of the following is highest quality coal?
solution:
(d)

Coal, Dry Carbon content (%)- Anthracite (86-92), Bituminous coal (76-86), Sub-Bituminous coal (70-76), Lignite(65-70), Peat (<60). Jharkhand (Jharia- Largest coal field) is the largest coal-producing state in India. Dhanbad (Coal Capital of India).

question: 49. What are the three parts of bacterial flagellum?
solution:
(d)

Filament, hook and basal body are three parts of bacterial flagellum. Basal Body: It is attached to the cell membrane and cytoplasmic membrane. Hook : It is a broader area present at the base of the filament, which connects filament to the motor protein in the base. Filament: Thin hair-like structure arising from the hook.

question: Common name of the compound CaOCl2 is _________.
solution:
(a)

Bleaching Powder (Calcium Oxychloride-CaOCl2), Gypsum (Calcium Sulfate Dihydrate-CaSO4·2H2O ). Baking soda (Sodium Bicarbonate- NaHCO3), Washing soda (Sodium Carbonate - Na2CO3.10H2O). Some more examples :- Blue Vitriol (Copper Sulphate- CaSO4 .xH2O), Carborundum (Silicon carbide - SiC), Caustic potash (Potassium hydroxide - KOH), Chile Saltpetre (Sodium Nitrate - NaNO3), Chloroform (Trichloromethane- CHCI3), Dolomite (Calcium magnesium carbonate, CaMg(CO3)2. Green Vitriol (Ferrous sulphate heptahydrate, FeSO4. 7H2O), Milk of magnesia (Magnesium hydroxide Mg(OH)2) etc.

question: x is a negative number such that k + k-1= - 2, then what is the value of k2+4k-2k2+k-5
solution:
(b)

k+k-1 =-2 k+1k=-2 Clearly , K = -1 Putting the value in given equation :- k2+4k-2k2+k-5 = 1-4-21-1-5 = -5-5 = 1

question: If (x +1x )=52, then what is the value of (x4 + x-4) ?
solution:
(d)

Formula :- When , x+1x= k , Then x2+1x2 = k2-2 Given that , x+1x=52 Then , x2+1x2 = 48 And x4+1x4 = 2302

question: A man rows a boat a certain distance downstream in 9 hours, while it takes 18 hours to row the same distance upstream. How many hours will it take him to row three-fifth of the same distance in still water?
solution:
53 .(b)

Here , Distance is constant then ratio of time is inversely proportional to the ratio of speed. Time 9 : 18 Speed 18 : 9 Speed (x+y) : (x-y) Total Distance = 18×9 = 162 Now, (x+y) = 18 ………(eq.1) (x-y) = 9 ………(eq.2) From eq. (1) and eq. (2) , we get x = 13.5 Time taken to cover 35th of the total distance = 162×35×13.5 = 7.2 hr.

question: A shopkeeper makes a net profit of 44% on selling an article at successive discounts of 10% and 20%. Find the net profit percentage, if the shopkeeper sells the same article at a discount of 15%.
solution:
(b)

Net discount = -10-20+10×20100 = 28% Now, C.PM.P. = 100-D%100+P% C.PM.P. = 72144 = 12 =100200 S.P. after 15% discount = 200×85100 = 170 Required Profit % = 170-100100×100% = 70%

question: What will be the value of sin 30° sin 40° sin 50° sin 60°cos30° cos40°cos 50° cos60° ?
solution:
(c)

Formula :- Sin(90-θ) = Cosθ Sin30°Sin40°Sin50°Sin60°Cos30°Cos40°Cos50°Cos60° Cos60°Cos50°Cos40°Cos30°Cos30°Cos40°Cos50°Cos60° = 1

question: What is the ratio between the HCF and LCM of the numbers whose LCM is 48 and the product of the numbers is 384?
solution:
(b)

Let , the no. be x and y

Product of number =x × y = 384

Formula :-

First Number × Second Number = L.C.M. × H.C.F.

384 = 48 × H.C.F.

H.C.F. = 8

H.C.F : L.C.M= 8 : 48 = 1 : 6

question: The price of a scooter increases successively by 10%, 5% and 15%. What is the total percentage increase in price of scooter?
solution:
(a)

Let , the Price of scooter = 100 units

Price after 10 % increase= 110 units

Price after another 5 % increase= 115.5 units

Price after another 15 % increase= 132.825 units

Total increase = 132.825 - 100 = 32.825% = 323340%

Short Tricks:-

Formula:- Net increase = a+b+c + ab+bc+ca100+abc10000 Net increase = 10 +5 +15 + 50+75+150100+75010000 = 30 + 2.75 + 0.075 = 32.825% = 323340%

question: If areas of similar triangles Δ ABC and ΔDEF are x² cm² and y² cm² respectively, and EF = a cm, then BC (in cm) is:
solution:
(c)

Given that △ABC and △DEF are similar Triangle , Then , ABDE = BCEF = CAFD = ar.△ABCar.△DEF According to question , x2y2 = BCa ⇒BC = axy

question: The average of the marks of 25 students in a class, in an examination was calculated to be 19. Later, the teacher realized that the marks of two students were taken as 18 and 19 respectively, instead of 14 and 15. Find the new actual average marks of the class.
solution:
(c)

Total marks of 25 students = 25×19 = 475

The marks of two student were taken as 18 and 19 respectively instead of 14 and 15

Difference = (18+19) - (14+15) = 8 mark extra

Accurate mark = 475 - 8 = 467

Required average = 46725 = 18.68

Short Tricks:-

In this type of question , always focus on changes made by mistake ,

Difference = (18+19) - (14+15) = 8 mark extra

Now, divide this in total number of student = 825 = 0.32

Now, the average affects by 0.32 marks .

Required average = 19 - 0.32 = 18.68 marks

question: Simplifyx9 × x5 × x-4 × x0 × x-6
solution:
61(a)

x9× x5× x-4× x0× x-6 = x9 × x5× 1x4× 1× 1x6 ………..( x0 = 1 ) = x4

question: The value of (sin30° cos60° - cos30° sin60°) is equal to:
solution:
62(b)

Formula :- Sin (a° -b°) =Sina°cosb°-cosa°Sinb° Now, Sin30°cos60°-cos30°Sin60° = Sin (30° -60°) Sin (-30°) = -Sin 30° ……….. {Sin (-a°) =-Sin a°}

question: What is the ratio of the mean proportional between 1.6 and 3.6 and the third proportional of 5 and 8?
solution:
63(c)

Mean Proportion of two number a and b = ab Third Proportion of two number a and b = b2a Now, Mean prop. : third Prop. 1.6×3.6 : 825 2.4×5 : 64 3 : 16

question: The difference between the cost price and selling price of a pair of shoes is Rs.1,200. If the profit is 15%, the selling price is:
solution:
64(b)

Profit % = 15% =+320

C.P. : S.P.

20 : 23

Difference between C.P. and S.P. is 3 units = 1200 Rs.

Now, S.P. = 23 units = 9200 Rs

question: .65. A person lent certain sum of money at the annual rate of 25 percent on simple interest. In 6 years the interest amounted to Rs.360 more than the sum lent. What is the sum lent?
solution:
65(c)

Let , the principal be x Rs.

Simple Interest = P×R×T100

x + 360 = x × 25×6100

2x + 720 = 3x

x = 720 Rs.

question: The side of an equilateral triangle is 12 cm. What is the radius of the circle circumscribing this equilateral triangle?
solution:
(b)

Circumradius of equilateral triangle = a3 ….. (a = side of equilateral△ ) Now, Circumradius = 123 = 43 cmShort Tricks:- Golden ratio for equilateral triangle :- Side : inradius : circumradius : height : perimeter : area 6k : 3k : 23k : 33k : 18k : 93 k2 Here . 6 units = 12 cm Then , 23 units = 43 cm

question:
The following table shows the number of different items in different shops and their respective selling prices per unit.

Find the percentage of total revenue which comes from Cooler from shop E, considering all given items are being sold from shop E and from all the given shops only given three items are being sold. (Rounded off to three decimal places)


https://ssccglpinnacle.com/admin/resources/qdocs/test-1-EN-1/1675051310/word/media/image45.png
solution:
67(a)

Total revenue which comes from cooler from shop E = 8000 × 4000 × 110 = 3200000

Total revenue which comes from all items from shop E =

4000{ 110×8000+510×26500+410×12200 } = 4000 {800+13250+4880 } = 75720000 Required % = 320000075720000×100 = 4.226%

question:
The following table shows the marks (in percentages) obtained by six students in four different subjects in an examination. Maximum marks in each subject are 100.

Answer the following question based on the table:
What is the number of students whose overall percentage obtained is 80% and above?


https://ssccglpinnacle.com/admin/resources/qdocs/test-1-EN-1/1675051310/word/media/image47.png
solution:
68(a)

Average of Student A = 92 +90+90+804 = 3524 = 88% Average of Student B = 90 +80+85+854 = 3404 = 85% Average of Student C = 80 +80+65+704 = 2954 = 73.75% Average of Student D = 85 +80+82+754 = 3224 = 80.5% Average of Student E = 80 +75+75+854 = 3154 = 78.75% Average of Student F = 90 +90+90+854 = 3554 = 88.75% Clearly , Four students obtained 80% and above that.

Short Tricks:-

Watch closely the given data Student A secured more than 80% marks in every subject Student B Also secured more than 80% marks in every subject C secured less than 80 % marks , D secured overall more than 80% marks , E did not secure , and F secured.

Clearly , Four students obtained 80% and above that.

solution:
69(d)

State s3 : State s4

400 : 500

4 : 5

question: What is the remainder when 8127 is divided by 8 ?
solution:
70(b)

Divisibility of 8 : last three digits of the given should be divisible by 8.

8127 :- on dividing 127 by 8 , we get remainder 7

question: A, B and C can complete a piece of work separately in 10, 20 and 40 days, respectively. In how many days will the work be completed if A is assisted by both B and C every third day?
solution:
71(a)

Total work = 80 units

Work done in first three days : - 8+8+(8+4+2) = 30 units

Next three days = 30 units

On seventh and eighth day = 8 + 8 units = 16 units

Remaining work = 80 units - 76 units = 4 units

Now, time require to complete 4 units =414 = 27 days

Total Days = 3 + 3+ 2 +27 = 827days


https://ssccglpinnacle.com/admin/resources/qdocs/test-1-EN-1/1675051310/word/media/image51.png

question: What is sinα - sinβ ?
solution:
72(a)

Formula :- Sina -Sinb = 2 Sina-b2Cosa+b2 sinα - sinβ = 2cosα+β2 sin α-β2

question: A hemisphere of lead of radius 4 cm is cast into a right circular cone of height 72 cm. What is the radius of the base of the cone?
solution:
73(c)

If any 3D figure cast into another 3D figure always equates their Volume . Volume of hemisphere = Volume of right circular cone 23πr13 = 13×πr22h ⇒ 23×43 = 13×r22×72 ⇒r22 = 2×6472 = 169 ⇒ r2 = 1.33 cm

question: If the angles of a triangle are (x - 46) degrees, ( x + 96) degrees and 8x degrees, then what is the value of 2x ?
solution:
74(c)

Sum of All angle of triangle is always 180°

(x-46°) +(x+96°) + 8x° = 180°

10x° = 180° -50°

2x° = 26°

question: O is the centre of this circle. Tangent drawn from a point P, touches the circle at Q. If PQ = 24 cm and OQ = 10 cm, then what is the value of OP?
solution:
75(a)

We know the angle formed between tangent and radius is always 90° .

In ΔOPQ

Using triplets ( 10 , 24 , 26 )

OP = 26 cm

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in passive voice.

Priya washes her clothes in the evening.
option_1: The clothes was washed by Priya in the evening.
option_2: The clothes is washed by Priya in the evening.
option_3: The clothes are washed by Priya in the evening.
option_4: The clothes were washed by Priya in the evening.
solution:
(c) The clothes are washed by Priya in the evening.

(a) The clotheswas washed by Priya in the evening. (Incorrect Tense)

(b) The clothesis washedby Priya in the evening. (Incorrect Tense)

(d) The clothes were washed by Priya in the evening. (Incorrect Tense)

question:
Select the option that contains a grammatical error in the underlined portion.

It would be impossible for them to continue living in this world if each of them knew exactly what fate had it store for them.
option_1: It would be impossible for themto continue living in this world if each of them knew exactly what fate had it store for them.
option_2: It would be impossible for them to continue living in this world if each of them knew exactly what fate had it store for them
option_3: It would be impossible for them to continue living in this world if each of them knew exactly what fate had it store for them.
option_4: It would be impossible for them to continue living in this world if each of them knew exactly what fate had it store for them.
solution:
(d)

It would be impossible for them to continue living in this world if each of them knew exactly what fate had it store for them.

“Had + V3(third form of the verb)” is the correct grammatical structure for the given sentence. Hence, ‘what fate had it stored(V3) for them’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank.

The doctor directed the nurse to administer an _________ medicine to the patient.
solution:
(c)

alternative.

‘Alternative’ means something that you can use, do, etc. instead of something else. The given sentence states that the doctor directed the nurse to administer an alternative medicine to the patient. Hence, ‘alternative’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Select the option that can be used as a one-word substitute for the given group of words.

A piece of a living tissue or plant that is transplanted surgically
solution:
(d)

Graft.

Gracious- kind

Gratis- done or given free of charge

Gourmet- a person who enjoys food and knows a lot about it

Graft- a piece of skin, bone, or other living tissue transplanted or to be transplanted from one body

question:
Select the correct active form of the given sentence.

The clothes will be delivered by the shop on Monday.
option_1: The shop will be delivering the clothes on Monday.
option_2: The shop will deliver the clothes on Monday.
option_3: The shop would be delivering the clothes on Monday.
option_4: The shop would deliver the clothes on Monday.
solution:
(b) The shop will deliver the clothes on Monday.

(a) The shop will be delivering the clothes on Monday. (incorrectTense )

(c) The shop would be delivering the clothes on Monday. (ncorrectTense )

(d) The shop would deliver the clothes on Monday. (ncorrect Verb )

question:
Select the most appropriate ANTONYM of the underlined word.

Failure to carry hall ticket to the exam is considered as a trivial issue.
solution:
(d)

Serious- needing to be treated as important

Trivial- something of little importance; not worth considering

Underrated- to think that somebody/something is less clever, important, good, etc.

Kind- caring about others; friendly and generous

Problematic- difficult to deal with or to understand

question:
Sentences of a paragraph are given below in jumbled order. Arrange the sentences in the correct order to form a meaningful and coherent paragraph.

A. A panther is reported to have broken into a house yesterday in search of food and shelter.

B. The villagers heard his cries and ran to the house but the scared animal had run away through the window by then.

C. It secretly slouched into a room where a young man named Johnny was sleeping, who suddenly woke up and realised that the beast was roaming around his bed.

D. Just as the panther was about to leap on him, he swiftly shot out of bed and hid in a closet.
solution:
(c)

ACDB

Sentence A will be the starting line as it contains the main idea of the parajumble i.e. A panther is reported to have broken into a house. However, Sentence C states that it secretly slouched into a room where a young man named Johnny was sleeping, who suddenly woke up and realised that the beast was roaming around his bed. So, C will follow A. Further, Sentence D states that as the panther was about to leap on him, he swiftly shot out of bed and hid in a closet & Sentence B states that the villagers heard his cries and ran to the house but the scared animal had run away through the window by then. So, B will follow D. Going through the options, option c has the correct sequence.

question: Select the INCORRECTLY spelt word.
solution:
(a)

Peircing.

‘Piercing’ is the correct spelling.

Piercing - cut through with a sharp instrument

Sleek - smooth and glossy

question:
Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank.

If you try to do something every day you will ________ progress.
solution:
(c)

make.

‘Make progress’ is a phrase that means the process of gradually improving or getting nearer to achieving or completing something. The given sentence states that if you try to do something every day you will make progress. Hence, ‘make’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Select the most appropriate synonym of the given word.

Competent
solution:
(c)

Capable- having the ability or qualities necessary to do something.

Competent- having the ability or skill needed for something

Complex- made up of several connected parts and often difficult to understand

Poor- not having enough money to have a comfortable life

Beginner- a person who is starting to do something or learn something for the first time

question:
Choose the correct meaning of the given idiom.

In weal and woe
solution:
(c)

In weal and woe - in prosperity and adversity

E.g.- Rahul is my best friend, I can count on him to be there in weal and woe.

question:
Select the most appropriate synonym of the given word.

Announce
solution:
(d)

Advertise- to announce publicly especially by a printed notice or a broadcast.

Announce- to make something known publicly and officially

Denounce- to say publicly that something is wrong

Secret- something that is not or must not be known by other people

Hide- to put or keep somebody/something in a place where he/she/it cannot be seen

question:
Rearrange the parts of the sentence in correct order.

While physical movement

P. activities may not require physical

Q. is important for children, all learning

R. the part of teachers and students

S. movement and facial expressions on
solution:
(d)

QPSR.

Part Q will be the starting part as it contains the main idea of the parajumble i.e. physical movement is important for children. Part P states that learning activities may not require physical movement. So, P will follow Q. Further, Part S talks about physical movement and facial expressions & part R states that they are not required on the part of teachers and students. So, R will follow S. Going through the options, option d has the correct sequence.

question:
Select the most appropriate meaning of the given idiom.

A green horn
solution:
(b)

A green horn- inexperienced person.

E.g.- Kamal is the only green horn in our office as he is a new recruit.

question:
Select the correct direct form of the given sentence.

He said that something might be missing in there.
option_1: He said, "Something may be missing in here."
option_2: He said, "Something had to be missing in there."
option_3: He said, "Something is been missing in here."
option_4: He said, "Something could be missing in here."
solution:
(a)He said, "Something may be missing in here."

(b) He said, "Something had tobe missing in there." (Incorrect Verb & Incorrect Preposition)

(c) He said, "Somethingis beenmissing in here." (Incorrect Sentence Structure)

(d) He said, "Something could be missing in here." (Incorrect Modal Verb)

question: Select the sentences that contains no spelling errors.
option_1: Many communities in the world still feel that their voices and position has been dissenfranchised.
option_2: Many communities in the world still feel that their voices and position has been dysenfranchised.
option_3: Many communities in the world still feel that their voices and position has been dysenfrenchized.
option_4: Many communities in the world still feel that their voices and position has been Disenfranchised.
solution:
(d)

Many communities in the world still feel that their voices and position has been
disenfranchised.
‘Disenfranchised’ is the correct spelling which is given only in the option ‘d’.

question:
Sentences of a paragraph are given below in jumbled order. Arrange the sentences in the correct order to form a meaningful and coherent paragraph.

A. They also wore felt caps to cover their ears.

B. They wore trousers tucked into leather boots.

C. This place was famous for its skilful archers and horsemen.

D. In the 5th and 4th centuries BC, today's south Ukraine was known as Scythia.
solution:
(d)

DCBA

Sentence D will be the starting line as it contains the main idea of the parajumble i.e. Today's South Ukraine was once known as Scythia. However, Sentence C states that this place was famous for its skilful archers and horsemen. So, C will follow D. Further, Sentence B states that they wore trousers tucked into leather boots & Sentence A states that they also wore felt caps to cover their ears. Going through the options, option d has the correct sequence.

question:
The following sentence has been split into four segments. Identify the segment that contains a grammatical error.

He used to reply / that the only place / for which he went / was the town library.
solution:
93.(b) for which he went

‘Where’ means in or to the place or situation mentioned. The given sentence states that the only place where he went was the library. Hence, ‘where he went’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Select the most appropriate synonym of the underlined word in the given sentence.

The sporadic instructions of the invigilators distracted the examinee.
solution:
(d)

Occasional- something done or happening from time to time but not very often

Sporadic- something not done or happening regularly

Continuous- happening or existing without stopping

Indirect- not being the direct cause of something

Repetitive- not interesting because the same thing is repeated many times

question:
Select the most appropriate option that can substitute the underlined segment in the given sentence.

Rajan is having three brothers and three sisters.
solution:
(b)Rajan has.

The given sentence is in the simple present tense so the verb must be used in the simple present form(V1) and not in the present continuous form(is + V-ing). Hence, ‘Rajan has(V1)’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze Test : In the following passage some words have been deleted. Fill in the blanks with the help of the alternatives given. Select the most appropriate option for each number. The modern-day student is extremely (96)______ with technology. They do read quite a bit because of social media. While their writing skills may not be top notch, they do write, courtesy (97) ______affinity to various platforms on the internet. However, one skill that has been (98)_____affected is listening skills. They are extremely poor (99)_______ listeners. If this issue is not addressed, what we may be heading to in the future is a huge chunk of people across the globe, with poor skills of listening, and a huge number of passive listeners. Researchers say that listening is the prime ingredient for empathy and the world will be in extreme poverty in terms of number of (100)________ on the planet.
Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank number 96.
solution:
(d)savvy.

‘Savvy’ means having common sense and good judgement about something. The given passage states that the modern-day student is extremely savvy with technology. Hence, ‘savvy’ is the most appropriate answer.
